results.title: Summer of Sam
results.creator_credit: Touchstone, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks, Jon Kilik and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Set in New York City in the summer of 1977, “Summer of Sam” examines the effects of a massive heatwave on the city as well as the paranoia and fear created by the random serial murders committed by a psychopath who only signed himself, Son of Sam. But though the serial killer plot sets the film in motion, “Summer of Sam” is about much much more, for it is in 1977 when the emerging anarchism of the punk movement collided with the hedonism of the disco era. The hunt for the Son of Sam is merged with the story of two couples: Vinny (John Leguizamo) and Diona (Mira Sorvino), a married Italo-American couple whose relationship is threatened by Vinny’s guilt-stricken affairs; and Ritchie (Aidrien Brody) and Gloria (Jennifer Esposito), two outcasts - he because he refuses to fit the macho stereotypes of the Italian culture, she because of her “slutty” past - who both find acceptance in the growing punk scene of downtown New York. By focussing his camera on the world of working-class Italo-Americans, Spike Lee is not abandoning his commitment to examining American racism. Instead, by accurately representing a segment of the white world in a specific historic and cultural moment, Lee reveals the underlying racism, misogyny and narrow-mindedness of American mass culture. Being a Spike Lee joint, the film is also a wonderful celebration of music, both disco and punk, as well as a sophisticated examination of love and marriage, and bisexuality. Fast-paced, with excellent art design and a superb score, “Summer of Sam” emerges as a bittersweet love poem to the city of New York: its clubs and its porn theatres, its residents black and white, its uptown charms and its downtown sleaze. A contender for the most underrated film of recent times.

results.title: Summer is for kids
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Sydney Newman and Stanley Jackson
results.brief_description: The warmly human narrative of what two weeks at a Muskoka summer camp meant to a small boy from a congested city area. School was out. Roger had passed. Next year he’d be using ink, but in the meantime there wasn’t much to do around town. Then, one wonderful day, Roger went off to camp. It was all fun, the preliminary scramble for the upper bunk in the cabin, exploring in the woods, cooking food over a fire, and - biggest day of all - passing the beginner’s swimming test. The two weeks went by so quickly, but it was the best time Roger had ever had, and one he would never forget. (Award: Toronto.)

results.title: Summer interlude = Sommarlek
results.brief_description: Summer interlude is Bergman’s poignant and lyrical study of young love. A young ballerina, Mari, falls in love with a fellow student (Henrik) and thy spend an idyllic summer together on an island near Stockholm where Mari lives unhappily with her uncle and his mistress. But the affair comes to a sudden and tragic end when Henrik is killed in an accident. Several years pass and Mari is now a prima ballerina, but still devastated and heartbroken by the loss. Bitter and without emotion she meets a young journalist, David) who has found the diary she wrote while Henrik was alive. The diary reawakens long dormant feelings and she gradually accepts David’s company and sets out to find a new happiness. This is Bergman’s first mature film and is a peotic evocation of the burden of memory and loss. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Summer interlude
results.brief_description: The lives of the inhabitants of a Swedish seaboard village that becomes a resort in summer are contrasted with those of visitors. The atmosphere of a little fishing village is beautifully caught - the impact of trippers on it equally well described. The film has all the best of Sucksdorff’s qualities - a strong pictorial style, human observation, and a simple flowing narrative.

results.title: Summer City
results.creator_credit: Summer City Productions, Phil Avalon and Christopher Fraser
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1960’s, four young men take off for a weekend fling in search of girls, surf, and thrills, but encounter fear and death. Stars Mel Gibson, Steve Bisley, John Jarratt and Abigail.

results.title: Sultans of swing: the very best of Dire Straits
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Video International and Marghie Evans
results.brief_description: ‘Sultans of swing’ features 16 of Dire Strait’s most popular songs including: “Sultans of swing”, “Lady writer”, “Romeo and Juliet”, “Tunnel of love”, “Private investigations”, “Twisting by the pool”, “Love over gold (live)”, “So far away”, “Money for nothing”, “Brothers in arms”, “Walk of life”, “Calling Elvis”, “Heavy fuel”, “On every street”, “Your latest trick (live)” and “Local hero - wild theme (live)”.

results.title: Sulphur and its compounds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Using molecular models, animation and time-lapse photography, this film demonstrates the chemical and physical properties of sulphur, including the formation of its allotropic forms. Also describes the Frasch process, and emphasises the importance of sulphur and its compounds, especially sulphuric acid, in modern industry, medicine and agriculture.

results.title: Suivez-Moi Jeune Homme! = Follow Me Young Man!
results.creator_credit: Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere and Guy Le Franc
results.brief_description:
Oranos, a wealthy greek business man, is in love with Francoise, a jewellery shop attendant, who consistantly rebuffs him. Suspecting she may already have a boyfriend, he is having her followed by Michel, a private detective, who promptly falls in love with her.

Credits: Producer, Paul Cadeac, Marcel Lathiere ; director, Guy Le Franc ; writers, Roland Moronval, Jean Halain ; photography, Maurice Barry ; music, Louiguy.
Cast: Dany Robin, Daniel Gelin, Lona Rita, Jacques Jouanneau, Noel Roquevert, Georges Chamarat, Michel Galabru, Fernand Sardoux.

results.title: Suicide: the warning signs
results.brief_description: Presents examples of changes in adolescent behaviour that may be indicative of suicidal tendencies. Ways of helping are suggested. No other credits available.

results.title: Suicide box
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A documentary video tape about the ‘Suicide Box’ - a motion triggered camera developed by the Bureau of Inverse Technology (a private information agency) and installed in range of the Golden Gate Bridge, San Fransisco. This vertical-motion triggered device is designed to capture a video record of anything that falls from the bridge in order to provide an accurate measure of the suicide rate at the bridge. Accuracy of measurement is often compromised by the presence of seagulls and brought into question by ironic observations about the contradictory roles played by technology within contemporary culture.
